Topics: stable implementation of belief propagation
For a stable implementation, should work in log space
Log-sum-exp operations are more stable if computed like this:
The    /    tables can be used to compute marginals
At each position k, pick label       with highest marginal probability
this choice is the one that minimizes the sum of the classification errors over the whole sequence, assuming the CRF is the true distribution
A Viterbi decoding algorithm can be used for that
forward pass: replace                              by                    and fill the table
backward pass: starting from the maximal value       at the last position, follow the backward trace of the max operations to decode the maximizing sequence

We have seen to define a distribution over a whole target sequence and do inference with this distribution
next class, we will see how inference is a subroutine required by stochastic gradient descent training
similar to forward propagation being required by backward propagation
We have focused on a simple type of CRF, with a linear chain structure
next class, we will discuss more general types of CRFs, with possibly arbitrary structure
You must implement a linear chain CRF without  hidden units (L=0):
lateral connections between adjacent class labels only
radius of size 1 for the context window
To predict the label, you can use either option 1 (prediction from marginals) or option 2 (Viterbi)
or try both and see which one works best!
